CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 3, 1955, pg. 22 reads: " Pony League Champs - Three of the key players on the Washington (Pa.) baseball team which won the Pony League world championship in Washington, Pa., last week, reminisce over the struggle they had winning the title. The youngsters are, left to right: Harold (Pete) Vactor, leftfielder; Fred (Reggie) Bolden, pitcher and first baseman, and Don Ferrell, shortstop.  Bolden was selected as the series most valuable player.  As a pitcher he won three of his team's six victories, and as a batter he led his mates in hitting.  in championship game he hurled a one-hitter as Washington defeated Youngstown, 4-0. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Washington Pennsylvania Pony League baseball players, from left, Harold "Pete" Vactor, Fred "Reggie" Bolden, and Don Ferrell, standing in yard on residential street, Washington, Pennsylvania
